name: Root Asus Transformer
body:
### Root/Restore Instructions - Asus Transformer
You can find two sections to root your tablet. To find your android version, go to settings on your tablet,  about section and find your Android Version.

* **Requierement**

For all version of your Asus Transformer, you must have Android SDK tools installed
Download ANDROID SDK ( http://developer.android.com/sdk/index.html )

* **Install tools from ANDROID SDK**

Go to your android-sdk directory and tools

On Mac OS X ( and other Unix platform ):

Install android tools 
```
./android 
( select tools and install )
```

On Windows:
Simply double click on android file, select tools and install.


### Unroot/Restore Asus Transformer
These instructions is the easiest way to unroot and restore your Asus Transformer.
At this time, it just work under Windows.

* **Requierement**

Download project archive into zip or tar.gz format. This archive content _nvFlashWW_ directory.
Your tablet must not be plug to your computer at beginning.

* **Unroot/Restore your tablet**

Start your Asus Transformer by pushing power button and Volume ( + ) during 8 seconds;
Your screen staying black, it's normal.

Plug it to your computer. Windows automatically detect your tablet.
If Windows notify that it can't install driver, go to "Driver Manager", select "Update driver on APX device". Then select update from computer and select _nvFlashWW/usbpcdriver_  directory, check "find in subdirectories".

Go to _nvFlashWW_ directory and launch _download_ bat file. 
Waiting reboot.

You have restored your tablet.
 

### Root Version TF101/TF201 (Prime) v4.0.x
These instructions is the easiest way to root Asus Transformer for Android 4.0.x. 
If you have an android version in 3.x got to _Version TF101 3.x_ section or upgrade your tablet to android 4.0.x.
It just work under Windows operating system.

* **Requierement**

Download project archive into zip or tar.gz format. This archive content _viperMOD PrimeTime v4.5_ directory.

Your tablet must not be plug to your computer at beginning.

* **Root your tablet**

Start your Asus Transformer by pushing power button and Volume ( + ) during 8 seconds;
Your screen staying black, it's normal.

Plug it to your computer. Windows automatically detect your tablet.
If Windows notify that it can't install driver, go to "Driver Manager", select "Update driver on APX device". Then select update from computer and select _viperMOD PrimeTime v4.5/usbpcdriver_  directory, check "find in subdirectories".

After drivers installed, go to _viperMOD PrimeTime v4.5_ and launch _viperMOD PrimeTime v4.5_ executable.

Select correct option ( must be option 1 ).

Follow instructions ( just press any key to continue at each step ).

When your Asus Transformer is rebooted, your tablet must be rooted. 

* **Finally**

Download superUser and Voodoo OTA RootKeeper from market to test root and activate it.
Voodoo OTA RootKeeper allow to backup root mode and activate or desactivate root mode to do some update.
Maybe you could wait some minutes during Android activate it.


### Root Version TF101 3.x
These instructions is the easiest way to root Asus Transformer for Android 3.x. 
This not work on Android 4.x

Download project archive into zip or tar.gz format. This archive content _nachoroot.bin_ and _su_ script.

* **Root your tablet**
Go to android-sdk directory and platform-tools

```
adb push nachoroot.bin /data/local/  
```
**You must specify the path where you have downloaded the project archive.**
**Example : adb push /Users/your_name/Desktop/nachoroot.bin /data/local/**

```     
adb shell chmod 777 /data/local/nachoroot.bin
adb shell /data/local/nachoroot.bin --stage1
adb reboot
```
**Wait during your tablet is rebooting**

```
adb shell /data/local/nachoroot.bin --stage2
adb reboot
```
**Wait during your tablet is rebooting**

```
adb shell id
```
**If id is different to 0, start over root instructions**

```
adb remount
adb  push  su  /system/xbin/su
```
**You must specify the path where you have downloaded the project archive.**
**Example : adb push /Users/your_name/Desktop/su /system/xbin/su**

```
adb shell chown 0.0 /system/xbin/su
adb shell chmod 06755 /system/xbin/su
adb shell /data/local/nachoroot.bin --undo
adb reboot
```
**Wait during your tablet is rebooting**

* **Finally**

Download superUser and Voodoo OTA RootKeeper from market to test root and activate it.
Voodoo OTA RootKeeper allow to backup root mode and activate or desactivate root mode to do some update.
Maybe you could wait some minutes during Android activate it.
tagline: How to root Asus transformer TF101/TF201 3.x and 4.0.x
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
